title: Rearrange expression and group like terms
text: In this expression, what is the like term of $$x^5$$?

title: Rearrange expression and group like terms
text: $$45$$ and $$-60$$ are consider as like terms because they are both real numbers. $$x^5$$ and $$x^8$$ are consider like terms because they are different power of a. Similar for $$y^9$$ and $$y^6$$
speech: 45  and  negative 60  are consider as like terms because they are both real numbers.  x to the fifth  and  x to the eighth  are consider like terms because they are different power of a. Similar for  y to the ninth  and  y to the sixth
pacedSpeech: are consider as like terms because they are both real numbers.   x to the fifth
are consider like terms because they are different power of a. Similar for   y to the ninth

title: Simplify each group
text: We can rewrite the given expression in a new way by grouping the like terms using parenthese, $$\frac{45x^5 x^9}{\left(-60x^8 x^6\right)}=\frac{45}{-60} \frac{x^5}{x^8} \frac{y^9}{y^6}$$
speech: We can rewrite the given expression in a new way by grouping the like terms using parenthese,  fraction, 45 x to the fifth x to the ninth, over, parentheses, negative 60 x to the eighth x to the sixth ,  is equal to fraction, 45 over, negative 60,  fraction, x to the fifth, over, x to the eighth, , fraction, y to the ninth, over, y to the sixth,

title: Simplify each group

subHints.title: Rules for simplify power
subHints.text: Given a real number $$x$$, and m,n integers, $$\frac{a^m}{a^n}=a^{m-n}$$ and $$a^m a^n=a^{m+n}$$

speech: Simplify  fraction, y to the ninth, over, y to the sixth,
pacedSpeech: Simplify   fraction, y to the ninth, over, y to the sixth,

title: Multiply each group together
text: Then, replace the each group with its simplified form we get $$\left(-\frac{3}{4}\right) \frac{1}{x^3} y^3$$
speech: Then, replace the each group with its simplified form we get  negative 3 fourths times, fraction, 1 over, x cubed,  y cubed
pacedSpeech: Then, replace the each group with its simplified form we get   negative 3 fourths times, fraction, 1 over, x cubed,  y cubed

title: Fraction mutiplication Rule
text: The final step is take $$\left(-\frac{3}{4}\right) \frac{1}{x^3} y^3$$ and turn it into fraction form using fraction multiplication.

subHints.title: Fraction mutiplication Rule
subHints.text: As a reminder, given fractions $$\frac{a}{b}$$ and $$\frac{d}{c}$$ where a, $$d$$ are real number, and $$b$$, c are non zero real number, $$\frac{a}{b} \frac{d}{c}=\frac{a d}{b c}$$. we can write $$y^3$$ as $$\frac{y^3}{1}$$

speech: The final step is take  negative 3 fourths times, fraction, 1 over, x cubed,  y cubed  and turn it into fraction form using fraction multiplication.

and turn it into fraction form using fraction multiplication.
